title: Calories in NY Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in NY steak for a standard 200g serving, plus protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition facts, and preparation tweaks.
assumptions: Boneless NY strip steak, choice grade, grilled without added fat, trimmed to 1/8" fat, ~200 g per steak.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by steak size, grade, trimming, cooking method, and additions. Based on USDA averages; check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: One 200g NY steak provides ~518 kcal and 53 g protein.

label_note: These values mirror standard Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in one NY steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 518 kcal for a 200g grilled NY steak.

faqs.q: How much protein is in NY steak?
What is the fat content in NY steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 32.8 g total fat, including 13 g saturated, per 200g steak.

faqs.q: Calories in NY steak per 100 g?
faqs.a: Around 259 kcal per 100 g cooked NY strip steak.

faqs.q: Does the grade affect calories in NY steak?
faqs.a: Yes; choice grade has more fat (~518 kcal/200g) than select (~438 kcal/200g).
